properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 11 at 3:53AM AKST until January 12 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations
of 6 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph.

* WHERE...Bristol Bay; north and west of King Salmon.

* WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 3 PM AKST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility to one half mile at
times.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Highest snow totals expected north of King
Salmon. Areas along the Bristol Bay coast can expect to see
blowing snow conditions this evening, with conditions improving
overnight. As the storm moves eastward through Sunday morning,
blowing snow conditions will shift to areas near Iliamna.
properties.instruction:
A winter weather advisory for snow and blowing snow means that
visibilities will be limited due to a combination of falling and
blowing snow. Use caution when traveling, especially in open
areas.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 3 PM AKST SUNDAY NORTH AND WEST OF KING SALMON
